ground_truth: They glance curiously at the car then resume their conversation. In the backseat, the hulking escapee's chest heaves as he stares fixedly at the red light. Dillinger licks his lips, his head bowed slightly. He reaches his left hand toward the gun nestled in his waistband. The light changes to green and Dillinger puts the car in gear. He glances over his shoulder as he turns on to another street. The escapee looks behind them. With a smirk, Dillinger shifts gears. The Ford speeds away from town as Youngblood keeps watch out the rear windshield. Now, the car cruises beside a field. Dillinger looks at the mechanic. He shakes his head light-heartedly. The befuddled mechanic shakes his head. During an interview, elsewhere, Hoover listens on the radio. He pinches the bridge of his nose. Now at her apartment, Billie sits in a chair, her hands fidgeting anxiously. She rushes to the telephone and leans against a wall as she holds the receiver to her ear. At the telephone exchange, Baum listens. Billie clutches the phone despondently. She lowers her sad, resigned eyes. Dillinger stands inside a phone booth with a faint, tender smile. Billie removes the receiver from her ear and clutches it against the base of her neck, resting her chin on her knuckles. Outside her apartment, two men watch from inside a car concealed underneath a bridge. Later, Purvis sits in a car outside the apartment. Baum climbs into the passenger seat and hands him a file with a transcript from Dillinger's phone call to Billie. Behind them, an el train glides across a bridge, its interior lights glowing in the darkness. A tan car pulls to a stop and Dillinger and Red climb out. As Dillinger heads around the corner, down an icy walkway, Sport steps out of the safe house. Red perches on the side of the car, his gun raised. Marty emerges from the house, behind Sport. Dillinger narrows his eyes and tilts his head. He pulls out his machine gun. Inside, a man waits by the doorway with a gun at the ready. Outside, Red aims his gun at the house. Later, Dillinger and Red burst into a cigar shop. Red grabs two customers. Gilbert stands behind one of the counters. Dillinger gives Gilbert a hard look. Gilbert leads Dillinger and Red upstairs to a dimly lit room. Dillinger takes in the chalkboard-covered walls and the rows of men at desks chattering on telephones. Small overhead lights with green lampshades hang from above next to dangling clusters of phone wires. D'Andrea sits on the corner of the desk. He looks at Gilbert. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms. Dillinger lifts his hands.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: They cast a curious glance at the car, momentarily distracted, before resuming their animated conversation. In the spacious backseat, the hulking escapee's chest rises and falls heavily as he stares intently at the glaring red traffic light. Dillinger, with a slight bow of his head, licks his lips thoughtfully. He extends his left hand toward the gun securely nestled in his waistband, feeling its reassuring presence. As the light shifts to green, Dillinger smoothly puts the car into gear. He casts a quick glance over his shoulder while skillfully turning onto another street. The escapee, ever vigilant, looks behind them. With a confident smirk, Dillinger shifts gears once more. The Ford accelerates, speeding away from the bustling town as Youngblood diligently keeps watch through the rear windshield. Now, the car glides effortlessly beside a sprawling field. Dillinger turns his gaze toward the mechanic, shaking his head in a light-hearted manner. The mechanic, appearing somewhat befuddled, shakes his head in response. Meanwhile, during an interview taking place elsewhere, Hoover listens intently to the radio. He pinches the bridge of his nose in contemplation. At her apartment, Billie sits restlessly in a chair, her hands fidgeting with nervous energy. She rushes to the telephone, leaning against the wall as she holds the receiver to her ear. At the telephone exchange, Baum listens attentively. Billie clutches the phone with a sense of despondency, lowering her sad, resigned eyes. Inside a phone booth, Dillinger stands with a faint, tender smile playing on his lips. Billie removes the receiver from her ear, clutching it against the base of her neck, resting her chin thoughtfully on her knuckles. Outside her apartment, two men watch intently from inside a car, concealed beneath the shadowy cover of a bridge. Later, Purvis sits in a car parked outside the apartment. Baum climbs into the passenger seat, handing him a file containing a transcript of Dillinger's phone call to Billie. Behind them, an el train glides smoothly across a bridge, its interior lights casting a warm glow in the enveloping darkness. A tan car pulls to a stop, and Dillinger and Red climb out with purpose. As Dillinger heads around the corner, navigating the icy walkway, Sport steps out of the safe house. Red perches on the side of the car, his gun raised and ready. Marty emerges from the house, following closely behind Sport. Dillinger narrows his eyes, tilting his head with determination. He pulls out his machine gun, feeling its weight. Inside, a man waits by the doorway, his gun at the ready. Outside, Red aims his gun steadily at the house. Later, Dillinger and Red burst into a cigar shop with urgency. Red swiftly grabs two unsuspecting customers. Gilbert stands behind one of the counters, observing the scene. Dillinger gives Gilbert a hard, scrutinizing look. Gilbert leads Dillinger and Red upstairs to a dimly lit room. Dillinger takes in the sight of the chalkboard-covered walls and the rows of men seated at desks, chattering busily on telephones. Small overhead lights with green lampshades hang from above, next to clusters of dangling phone wires. D'Andrea sits casually on the corner of the desk, casting a glance at Gilbert. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms, and Dillinger complies, lifting his hands.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: They directed a curious glance toward the automobile, their attention momentarily diverted before they resumed their animated conversation with renewed vigor. Situated comfortably in the spacious backseat, the hulking escapee's chest heaves up and down with heavy breaths as he fixates intently on the glaringly red traffic light ahead. Dillinger, with a slight inclination of his head, thoughtfully licks his lips. He extends his left hand with purpose toward the gun securely nestled in his waistband, reassured by its familiar presence. When the light shifts to green, Dillinger effortlessly puts the car into gear, casting a quick and cautious glance over his shoulder while skillfully maneuvering onto a different street. Ever vigilant, the escapee looks behind them with keen eyes. Wearing a confident smirk, Dillinger shifts gears once more, propelling the Ford forward with increasing speed, leaving the bustling town in their wake as Youngblood diligently keeps a close watch through the car's rear windshield. Now, the vehicle glides effortlessly beside a sprawling, open field. Dilinger turns his gaze toward the mechanic, shaking his head in a light-hearted manner that suggests camaraderie. The mechanic, appearing somewhat befuddled, mirrors the gesture with a shake of his own head. Meanwhile, elsewhere during an unrelated interview, Hoover listens intently to the radio, pinching the bridge of his nose in a contemplative manner. In her apartment, Billie sits restlessly in a chair, her hands fidgeting with nervous energy and anticipation. With urgency, she rushes to the telephone, leaning against the wall as she holds the receiver close to her ear. At the telephone exchange, Baum listens with focused attention. Billie clutches the phone with a sense of despondency, lowering her sad, resigned eyes. Inside a phone booth, Dillinger stands with a faint, tender smile playing on his lips. Billie removes the receiver from her ear, clutching it against the base of her neck while resting her chin thoughtfully on her knuckles. Outside her apartment, two men watch intently from within a car, concealed beneath the shadowy cover provided by a bridge. Later, Purvis sits in a car parked right outside the apartment. Baum joins him by climbing into the passenger seat, handing over a file containing a transcript of Dillinger's phone call to Billie. Behind them, an el train glides smoothly over a bridge, with its interior lights casting a warm glow that pierces through the enveloping darkness. A tan car comes to a halt, and with purpose and determination, Dillinger and Red step out. As Dillinger navigates around the corner, carefully treading the icy walkway, Sport emerges from the safe house. Red perches himself on the side of the car, his gun raised and ready for any encounter. Marty exits the house, closely following Sport. Dillinger narrows his eyes, tilting his head with steely determination, and pulls out his machine gun, feeling its formidable weight. Inside, a man waits by the doorway, his gun positioned and ready. Outside, Red aims his gun steadily at the house, intent on his target. Later, with a sense of urgency, Dillinger and Red burst into a cigar shop. Red swiftly seizes two unsuspecting customers with precision. Gilbert, observing the unfolding scene from behind one of the counters, receives a hard, scrutinizing look from Dillinger. Gilbert then leads Dillinger and Red upstairs to a dimly lit room, where Dillinger takes in the sight of chalkboard-covered walls and rows of men seated at desks, busily chattering on telephones. Small overhead lights with green lampshades hang from the ceiling, alongside clusters of dangling phone wires. Casually sitting on the corner of the desk, D'Andrea casts a glance at Gilbert. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms, and with compliance, Dillinger lifts his hands without hesitation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: They glance curiously at the car, their eyes briefly flicking over its exterior, before they turn back to each other and resume their conversation, their voices blending into the ambient noise. In the backseat, the hulking escapee's chest rises and falls heavily, each breath a visible effort, as he fixes his gaze intently on the red traffic light ahead. Dillinger, with a slight downward tilt of his head, moistens his lips with a quick flick of his tongue. His left hand moves deliberately toward the gun nestled securely in his waistband, fingers brushing against the cool metal. As the traffic light shifts from red to green, Dillinger smoothly engages the car into gear, the engine responding with a low rumble. He casts a quick glance over his shoulder, ensuring the path is clear, before deftly turning onto another street. The escapee, vigilant, turns his head to look behind them, scanning for any signs of pursuit. With a confident smirk playing on his lips, Dillinger shifts gears, the Ford accelerating smoothly as it leaves the town behind. Youngblood, seated in the back, keeps a watchful eye on the road behind through the rear windshield. The car now glides alongside a field, the landscape blurring past. Dillinger turns his attention to the mechanic, offering a light-hearted shake of his head, a gesture met with the mechanic's own bewildered shake. Elsewhere, during an interview, Hoover listens intently to the radio, his brow furrowing as he pinches the bridge of his nose in frustration. Meanwhile, at her apartment, Billie sits in a chair, her hands moving restlessly, betraying her anxious state. She suddenly rises and hurries to the telephone, leaning against the wall for support as she presses the receiver to her ear. At the telephone exchange, Baum listens attentively, his focus unwavering. Billie clutches the phone tightly, her expression one of despondency, as her eyes lower, filled with resignation. In a phone booth, Dillinger stands with a faint, tender smile playing on his lips. Billie, overwhelmed, removes the receiver from her ear, holding it against the base of her neck, her chin resting on her knuckles in a moment of contemplation. Outside her apartment, two men sit inside a car, their presence concealed beneath the shadow of a bridge, watching intently. Later, Purvis sits in a car parked outside the apartment, his gaze fixed ahead. Baum climbs into the passenger seat, handing Purvis a file containing a transcript of Dillinger's phone call to Billie. Behind them, an el train glides smoothly across a bridge, its interior lights casting a warm glow in the encroaching darkness. A tan car comes to a halt, and Dillinger and Red step out, their movements purposeful. As Dillinger makes his way around the corner, navigating the icy walkway with care, Sport emerges from the safe house, his presence a silent acknowledgment. Red positions himself on the side of the car, his gun raised in readiness. Marty follows Sport out of the house, his steps echoing in the quiet. Dillinger narrows his eyes, his head tilting slightly as he assesses the situation, before pulling out his machine gun, the weight familiar in his hands. Inside, a man stands by the doorway, his own gun poised and ready. Outside, Red maintains his aim at the house, his focus unyielding. Later, Dillinger and Red burst into a cigar shop, their entrance abrupt and commanding. Red swiftly grabs two customers, securing them with a firm grip. Behind one of the counters, Gilbert stands, his posture tense. Dillinger fixes Gilbert with a hard look, a silent demand for compliance. Gilbert, understanding the unspoken command, leads Dillinger and Red upstairs to a dimly lit room. Dillinger takes in the scene, noting the chalkboard-covered walls and the rows of men seated at desks, their voices a constant murmur as they chatter on telephones. Small overhead lights with green lampshades cast a muted glow, interspersed with clusters of dangling phone wires. D'Andrea sits casually on the corner of a desk, his gaze meeting Gilbert's in silent communication. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms, a request Dillinger complies with, lifting his hands in a gesture of acquiescence.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: They glance curiously at the car before resuming their conversation. In the backseat, the escapee breathes heavily while fixating on the red light. Dillinger, with a slight bow of his head, reaches for the gun in his waistband. As the light turns green, he shifts the car into gear, checks over his shoulder, and turns onto another street. The escapee looks back, and with a smirk, Dillinger accelerates the Ford away from town as Youngblood watches through the rear windshield. The car cruises beside a field, and Dillinger exchanges a light-hearted look with the confused mechanic. Meanwhile, Hoover listens to a radio interview, pinching the bridge of his nose. At her apartment, Billie anxiously fidgets before rushing to the phone, leaning against the wall as she listens. At the telephone exchange, Baum listens in, while Billie clutches the phone despondently, lowering her eyes. Dillinger, in a phone booth, smiles tenderly. Billie removes the receiver, resting it against her neck. Outside her apartment, two men watch from a car under a bridge. Later, Purvis sits in a car outside the apartment as Baum hands him a file with Dillinger's call transcript. An el train glides across a bridge behind them. A tan car stops, and Dillinger and Red exit. Dillinger heads down an icy walkway as Sport emerges from the safe house, and Red, gun raised, perches on the car. Marty follows Sport out. Dillinger narrows his eyes, pulls out his machine gun, and Red aims at the house. Later, Dillinger and Red storm into a cigar shop, with Red grabbing two customers. Gilbert, behind a counter, receives a hard look from Dillinger and leads them upstairs to a dimly lit room filled with men on phones, chalkboard-covered walls, and green-shaded lights. D'Andrea, sitting on a desk corner, exchanges a look with Gilbert. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms, and he complies.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They glance curiously at the car, a sleek Ford Model A known for its speed and reliability during the 1930s, then resume their conversation. In the backseat, the hulking escapee's chest heaves as he stares fixedly at the red light, signaling a potential escape route ahead. Dillinger, the infamous bank robber of the 1930s, licks his lips, his head bowed slightly in concentration. He reaches his left hand toward the gun nestled in his waistband, a common Colt M1911 which was a popular choice for criminals of that era. The light changes to green and Dillinger puts the car in gear. He glances over his shoulder as he turns on to another street, expertly navigating the intricate grid of downtown Chicago. The escapee looks behind them, ensuring they're not followed by police cars. With a smirk, Dillinger shifts gears. The Ford speeds away from town as Youngblood, trusted member of Dillinger's gang, keeps watch out the rear windshield. Now, the car cruises beside a field, perhaps one of the many cornfields common in rural Illinois. Dillinger looks at the mechanic, someone who often helped maintain their getaway vehicles. He shakes his head light-heartedly. The befuddled mechanic shakes his head. During an interview, elsewhere, Hoover, the FBI director determined to capture Dillinger, listens on the radio. He pinches the bridge of his nose, frustrated by the lack of progress. Now at her apartment, Billie, Dillinger's girlfriend, sits in a chair, her hands fidgeting anxiously. She rushes to the telephone and leans against a wall, reflecting the tension of being associated with a wanted criminal, as she holds the receiver to her ear. At the telephone exchange, Baum, an FBI agent involved in the Dillinger case, listens. Billie clutches the phone despondently, acutely aware of the consequences of her connection to Dillinger. She lowers her sad, resigned eyes. Dillinger stands inside a phone booth with a faint, tender smile, perhaps the only solace he finds amid a life on the run. Billie removes the receiver from her ear and clutches it against the base of her neck, resting her chin on her knuckles. Outside her apartment, two men watch from inside a car concealed underneath a bridge, likely FBI agents staking out the location. Later, Purvis, another prominent FBI agent known for his role in bringing down Dillinger, sits in a car outside the apartment. Baum climbs into the passenger seat and hands him a file with a transcript from Dillinger's phone call to Billie. Behind them, an el train, a fixture in Chicago's public transit system, glides across a bridge, its interior lights glowing in the darkness. A tan car pulls to a stop and Dillinger and Red, one of his accomplices, climb out. As Dillinger heads around the corner, down an icy walkway, Sport steps out of the safe house, a notorious hideout for criminals during that time. Red perches on the side of the car, his gun, a Browning Automatic Rifle often used by gangsters, raised. Marty emerges from the house, behind Sport. Dillinger narrows his eyes and tilts his head. He pulls out his machine gun, a Thompson submachine gun, favored for its firing speed. Inside, a man waits by the doorway with a gun at the ready, prepared for any law enforcement interference. Outside, Red aims his gun at the house. Later, Dillinger and Red burst into a cigar shop, a well-known front for illicit activities during Prohibition. Red grabs two customers. Gilbert, a trusted associate known for handling underground operations, stands behind one of the counters. Dillinger gives Gilbert a hard look. Gilbert leads Dillinger and Red upstairs to a dimly lit room. Dillinger takes in the chalkboard-covered walls and the rows of men at desks chattering on telephones, reminiscent of an illegal betting operation. Small overhead lights with green lampshades hang from above next to dangling clusters of phone wires. D'Andrea, involved in the local rackets, sits on the corner of the desk. He looks at Gilbert. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms. Dillinger lifts his hands, complying with the routine security checks of such establishments.

test_cases.description: They glance curiously at the car then resume their conversation. In the backseat the hulking escapee's chest heaves as he stares fixedly at the red light. Dillinger licks his lips his head bowed slightly. He reaches his left hand toward the gun nestled in his waistband. The light changes to green and Dillinger puts the car in gear. He glances over his shoulder as he turns on to another street. The escapee looks behind them. With a smirk Dillinger shifts gears. The Ford speeds away from town as Youngblood keeps watch out the rear windshield. Now the car cruises beside a field. Dillinger looks at the mechanic. He shakes his head lightheartedly. The befuddled mechanic shakes his head. During an interview elsewhere Hoover listens on the radio. He pinches the bridge of his nose. Now at her apartment Billie sits in a chair her hands fidgeting anxiously. She rushes to the telephone and leans against a wall as she holds the receiver to her ear. At the telephone exchange Baum listens. Billie clutches the phone despondently. She lowers her sad resigned eyes. Dillinger stands inside a phone booth with a faint tender smile. Billie removes the receiver from her ear and clutches it against the base of her neck resting her chin on her knuckles. Outside her apartment two men watch from inside a car concealed underneath a bridge. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Later Purvis sits in a car outside the apartment. Baum climbs into the passenger seat and hands him a file with a transcript from Dillinger's phone call to Billie. Behind them an el train glides across a bridge. its interior lights glowing in the darkness. A tan car pulls to a stop and Dillinger and Red climb out. As Dillinger heads around the corner down an icy walkway. Sport steps out of the safe house. Red perches on the side of the car his gun raised. Marty emerges from the house behind Sport. Dillinger narrows his eyes and tilts his head. He pulls out his machine gun. Inside a man waits by the doorway with a gun at the ready. Outside Red aims his gun at the house. Later Dillinger and Red burst into a cigar shop. Red grabs two customers. Gilbert stands behind one of the counters. Dillinger gives Gilbert a hard look. Gilbert leads Dillinger and Red upstairs to a dimly lit room. Dillinger takes in the chalkboardcovered walls and the rows of men at desks chattering on telephones. Small overhead lights with green lampshades hang from above next to dangling clusters of phone wires. D'Andrea sits on the corner of the desk. He looks at Gilbert. A blonde man gestures for Dillinger to raise his arms. Dillinger lifts his hands.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: They glance curiously at the car then resume their conversation. In the backseat the hulking escapee's chest heaves as he stares fixedly at the red light. Dillinger licks his lips his head bowed slightly. He reaches his left hand toward the gun nestled in his waistband. The light changes to green and Dillinger puts the car in gear. He glances over his shoulder as he turns on to another street. The escapee looks behind them. With a smirk Dillinger shifts gears. The Ford speeds away from town as Youngblood keeps watch out the rear windshield. Now the car cruises beside a field. Dillinger looks at the mechanic. He shakes his head lightheartedly. The befuddled mechanic shakes his head. During an interview elsewhere Hoover listens on the radio. He pinches the bridge of his nose. Now at her apartment Billie sits in a chair her hands fidgeting anxiously. She rushes to the telephone and leans against a wall as she holds the receiver to her ear. At the telephone exchange Baum listens. Billie clutches the phone despondently. She lowers her sad resigned eyes. Dillinger stands inside a phone booth with a faint tender smile. Billie removes the receiver from her ear and clutches it against the base of her neck resting her chin on her knuckles. Outside her apartment two men watch from inside a car concealed underneath a bridge. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They peek suspiciously at the bicycle then continue their debate. In the trunk, the tiny tourist's foot twitches as he glances nervously at the blue balloon. Winchester scratches his nose, his gaze tilted slightly. He extends his right foot toward the trumpet tucked in his backpack. The balloon drifts to violet and Winchester kicks the bicycle into motion. He squints over his elbow as he spins on to another avenue. The tourist peers ahead of them. With a grin, Winchester adjusts the pedals. The canoe drifts away from the island as Nightberry monitors the view out the side window. Now, the bicycle flies beside a mountain. Winchester sneers at the dentist. He shrugs his shoulders thoughtfully. The puzzled dentist arches his eyebrow. During a game, elsewhere, Greenway snoozes on the hammock. He rubs the bottom of his shoe. Now at his castle, Bessie reclines on a bench, her feet tapping nervously. She hurries to the stereo and leans against the chimney as she grips the remote to her chest. At the broadcast center, Pine listens. Bessie clenches the remote despairingly. She raises her weary, distant stare. Winchester lounges inside a playground with a faint, amused grin. Bessie removes the remote from her chest and presses it against the back of her elbow, resting her cheek on her fingertips. Outside her castle, two owls spy from inside a boat concealed beneath a shelter. Later, Alcott floats in a raft outside the mansion. Pine leaps into the driver’s seat and tosses him a basket with a report from Winchester's radio song to Bessie. Behind them, a hot air balloon floats beneath a canopy, its exterior lights flickering in the twilight. A navy ship pulls to a halt and Winchester and Blue jump out. As Winchester tiptoes around the square, down a sandy path, Cloud emerges from the barn. Blue lounges on the edge of the ship, his lantern raised. Charlie appears from the barn, beside Cloud. Winchester narrows his vision and tilts his foot. He reaches for his fishing pole. Inside, a woman sits by the window with a trumpet at the ready. Outside, Blue points his lantern at the barn. Later, Winchester and Blue dash into a bakery. Blue corrals two bakers. Cecil squats behind one of the ovens. Winchester gives Cecil a curious glance. Cecil guides Winchester and Blue downstairs to a brightly lit cellar. Winchester admires the mural-covered ceiling and the rows of women at tables singing into microphones. Large floor lamps with pink shades stand nearby next to dangling bundles of rubber bands. Libby lounges on the armrest of the sofa. She glances at Cecil. A brunette woman signals for Winchester to wave his fingers. Winchester nods his head.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dillinger sits in a car with an escapee, anxiously eyeing a red light. As it turns green, Dillinger drives away, smirking as his companion Youngblood keeps watch. Elsewhere, Billie anxiously awaits a call, while under surveillance by agents. Purvis receives a transcript of Dillinger's conversation with Billie. Dillinger and Red later arrive at a safe house, ready for confrontation, weapons drawn. They proceed to a cigar shop where Dillinger exchanges tense looks with Gilbert before being led to a room filled with men on phones. D'Andrea and a blonde man watch over the proceedings as Dillinger raises his hands.
